children.text: Select the most appropriate synonym of the underlined word. The National Leaders of India were imbued with qualities like leadership, nationalities and bravery.

The following sentence has been split into four segments. Identify the segment that contains a grammatical error. He did not hardly know / anyone in the city, / therefore, he felt homesick / all the time.

The following sentence has been divided into parts. One of them may contain an error. Select the part that contains the error from the given options. If you don’t find any error, mark ‘No error’ as your answer. Saleem has a tendency to switch / off his mobile when things / are not favourable for him.

options: Saleem has a tendency to switch

children.text: Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence. If there is no need to substitute it, select ‘No substitution’. Having turned up on the proposal, I felt disappointed over the entire issue.
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in reported speech. My father said to me, “Slow and steady wins the race.”

options: My father taught me that slow and steady wins the race.
My father taught me that slow and steady has won the race
My father told me that slow and steady has won the race
My father told me that slow and steady win the race

children.text: Select the most appropriate antonym of the given word. Solitude
Select the most appropriate antonym of the given word. Blitz
Select the option that gives the most appropriate meaning of the following word. Viable
Select the most appropriate antonym of the given word. Defile
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in indirect speech. The lady said, “Most of the trains are running late today.”

options: The lady said that most of the trains were running late today.
The lady said that most of the trains were running late that day.
The lady said that most of the trains are running late that day.
The lady said that most of the trains were running late the next day.

children.text: The following sentence has been divided into parts. One of them may contain an error. Select the part that contains the error from the given options. If you don’t find any error, mark ‘No error’ as your answer. The world will / not stop for you, / it will keep on going.
Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom. Blow hot and cold
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in indirect speech. Simon said to me, “He is not well.”

options: Simon told me that he was not well
Simon told him that I am not well.
Simon told me that he is not well.
Simon told him that he was not well

children.text: Select the option that expresses the given sentence in reported speech. Shreya said, “I have been feeling very hungry.”

options: Shreya said that she have been feeling very hungry.
Shreya said that she has been feeling very hungry.
Shreya said that she was feeling very hungry.
Shreya said that she had been feeling very hungry.

children.text: Choose the correct meaning of the given idiom. By leaps and bounds

Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence. If there is no need to substitute it, select ‘No substitution’. Music soothes and relieves you of any stress and negative emotions.
Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence. Right in the valley was a huge, ancient edifice, possibly/obviously belonging to the Middle Ages.

In the following passage, some words have been deleted. Read the passage carefully and select the most appropriate option to fill in the blanks. Scientists have determined that the human tongue is attuned to several (1)___ like sweet, salty, bitter, sour, savoury and possibly fat. Telling the difference between these tastes was crucial for human (2).
Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word. Capable

The following sentence has been divided into parts. One of them may contain an error. Select the part that contains the error from the given options. If you don’t find any error, mark ‘No error’ as your answer. He was happy because / his friends voted / in favour to him.

Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence. If there is no need to substitute it, select ‘No substitution required’. You can follow the instructions faithful, to avoid being disqualified.

options: shall be followed by the instructions faithfully

children.text: Select the option that expresses the given sentence in indirect speech. Mr. Collin said, “Let me deliver the letters to the postman”.

options: Mr. Collin requested that he might be allowed to deliver the letters to the postman.
Mr. Collin suggested with joy that he wished to deliver the letters to the postman
Mr. Collin said that let he be allowed to deliver the letters to the postman
Mr. Collin asked if he was allowed to deliver the letters to the postman.

children.text: Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice. His father fed the kids every day.

options: The kids had been fed by the father every day.
The kids were fed by his father every day.
The kids were being fed by his father every day.
The kids have been fed by his father every day.

children.text: Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice. People don't use this road much.

options: This road cannot be used much by people.
This road isn't much used by people
This road isn't used much by public.

children.text: Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice. He had not committed the mistake.

options: The mistake was not committed by him
The mistake has not been committed by him
Had the mistake been committed by him?
The mistake had not been committed by him

children.text: Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word. Obligation
The following sentence has been divided into parts. Identify the part that contains the error. He is faster enough / to defeat / the current record holder.
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice. Mr. Gupta and his brothers remodelled their house to help it sell.

options: Their house was to be remodelled by Mr. Gupta and his brothers to help it sell.
Their house was remodelled by Mr. Gupta and his brothers to help it sell.
Their house was being remodelled by Mr. Gupta and his brothers to help it sell.
Their house is remodelled by Mr. Gupta and his brothers to help it sell.

children.text: Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence. How much books do you think can this box hold?
Select the most appropriate synonym of the word 'ignominy' in the given sentence. They feared the ignominy of being exposed as spies.
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice. Daniel is buying a car.

options: A car is bought by Daniel.
A car is buy by Daniel.
A car were being bought by Daniel.
A car is being bought by Daniel.

children.text: Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence. Ria’s mother equally divided the chocolates among both her daughters.
Identify the segment that contains a grammatical error. The doctors claim to discover / a cure for cancer, / and the medicine will be put / to test very soon.

options: and the medicine will be put

children.text: Select the most appropriate meaning of the idiom 'At the eleventh hour'.
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice. Nargis quickly picks out the important files from her office shelf.

options: The important files will be quickly picked out by Nargis from her office shelf.
The important files have quickly been picked out by Nargis from her office shelf.
The important files are quickly being picked out by Nargis from her office shelf.
The important files are quickly picked out by Nargis from her office shelf.

children.text: Select the option that expresses the given sentence in indirect speech. “Leave me alone” yelled the little boy in the movie, “or else I will start shouting loudly.”

options: The little boy wanted to be left alone or else he will start shouting loudly.
The little boy requested to be left alone or else he would start shouting loudly.
The little boy in the movie cried to be left alone or else he shall start shouting loudly.
The little boy in the movie shouted that he should be left alone or else he would start shouting loudly.

children.text: Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice. His parents will send him to a boarding school next year.

options: He is to be sent to a boarding school next year by his parents.
He will be sent to a boarding school by his parents next year.
He would be sent to a boarding school next year by his parents.
He will be sent to a boarding school next year by his parents.

children.text: Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word. Omission
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in active voice. When will the dress be returned?

options: When shall you return the dress?
When will you be returning the dress?
When would you return the dress?
When will you return the dress?

children.text: Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word. Exaggeration
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in indirect speech: “I've just bought a car,” said Amar, "But it isn't insured yet. So I cannot take you for a ride."

options: Amar said that he had just bought a car but it wasn't insured till then. So, he could not take me for a ride.
Amar said that he had just bought the car but it wasn't insured till then. So, he could not take me for a ride.
Amar said that he just bought a car but it wasn't insured till then. So, he could not take me for a ride
Amar said that he had just bought a car but it wasn't insured till then. So, he could not be taken for a ride

children.text: Select the option that gives the most appropriate meaning of the following word. Crude

The given sentence is divided into three segments. Select the option that has the segment with a grammatical error. If there is no error, select 'no error’ as your answer: She will be a/ successful lawyer in/ the next few years.
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in direct speech: The reporter said that an event had been organised for the President the previous day.

options: The reporter said, “Let’s organise an event for the President the next day.”
The reporter said, "An event was organised for the President yesterday."
The reporter said, "An event is organised for the President today."
The reporter said, "An event is organised for the President yesterday."

children.text: Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word. Seizure

Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank: The thief _____ entered the house.

Select the grammatically correct sentence.

options: The scholastic arguments of an scientist had the great impact on the visiting students.
A scholastic arguments of the scientist had the great impact on the visiting students
The scholastic arguments of a scientist had an great impact on the visiting students.
The scholastic arguments of the scientist had a great impact on the visiting students

children.text: Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence. If there is no need to substitute it, select ‘No substitution’: Some children surprisingly take on their grandparents in appearance.
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice: The lion was chasing the stag behind the bush.

options: The stag had been chased by the lion behind the bush
The stag was chased by the lion behind the bush
The stag is being chased by the lion behind the bush
The stag was being chased by the lion behind the bush

children.text: Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom: Take away your breath
The following sentence has been divided into parts. Select the part that contains the error: By next March, we will had been living here for ten years.
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in indirect speech: The team manager said, “Let’s have some refreshments.”

options: The team manager regretted that we should have some refreshments.
The team manager requested that we should have some refreshments.
The team manager suggested that we may have some refreshments.
The team manager suggested us to have some refreshments

children.text: Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice: Mary was cooking the meal.

options: The meal were being cooked by Mary.
The meal was already being cooked by Mary.
Mary was about to cook the meal.
The meal was being cooked by Mary.

children.text: The given sentence is divided into three segments. Select the option that has the segment with a grammatical error. If there is no error, select 'no error’ as your answer: Rosa will have / graduate from a reputed / university in 4 years.
Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word: Confess

The following sentence has been divided into parts. One of them may contain an error. Select the part that contains the error from the given options. If you don’t find any error, mark ‘No error’ as your answer: Not only will he take admission here / but also he will stay / in the hostel.

options: Not only will he take admission here

children.text: Which of the following is true about the average life expectancy of India?

options: Average life expectancy of India is consistent since centuries now

Average life expectancy of India is consistently rising
Average life expectancy of India is the highest in Asia-Pacific region
